intro: Anoplon fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typical of the genus Anoplon. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Anoplon fasciculatum is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient plant in dry environments.
